src

Class GenericClock

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.SwingWorker<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>
      • src.GenericClock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Integer>, java.util.concurrent.RunnableFuture<java.lang.Integer>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EventClock

    public class GenericClock
extends javax.swing.SwingWorker<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>
    Clock element that controls events based on system time or internal counters. Root -generic- clock, containing basic operations shared by all kind of clock elements. It behaviour tries to imitate a real clock, iterating over its main loop every one second.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class javax.swing.SwingWorker

    • Field Detail

      • hour

        int hour
        Clock time components. Clock time values are represented by three componentes: - Seconds. - Minutes (1 minute = 60 seconds). - Hours (1 hour = 60 minutes). Time values are represented in digital format, being 00:00:00 the min. time value, and 23:59:59 the max. time value.

      • minute

        int minute
        Clock time components. Clock time values are represented by three componentes: - Seconds. - Minutes (1 minute = 60 seconds). - Hours (1 hour = 60 minutes). Time values are represented in digital format, being 00:00:00 the min. time value, and 23:59:59 the max. time value.

      • second

        int second
        Clock time components. Clock time values are represented by three componentes: - Seconds. - Minutes (1 minute = 60 seconds). - Hours (1 hour = 60 minutes). Time values are represented in digital format, being 00:00:00 the min. time value, and 23:59:59 the max. time value.

      • label

        final javax.swing.JLabel label
        GUI Label attached to the clock, used to represent time values.

      • paused

        boolean paused
        Behaviour control variable. Clock transits between "running/active", "paused" and "stopped" states. In each state, Clock executes a different set of operations. - Running: paused is FALSE, stopped is FALSE. - Paused: paused is TRUE, stopped is FALSE. - Stopped: stopped is TRUE (paused value is irrelevant). This variable indicates if clock is in 'paused' state.

      • stopped

        boolean stopped
        Behaviour control variable. Clock transits between "running/active", "paused" and "stopped" states. In each state, Clock executes a different set of operations. - Running: paused is FALSE, stopped is FALSE. - Paused: paused is TRUE, stopped is FALSE. - Stopped: stopped is TRUE (paused value is irrelevant). This variable indicates if clock is in 'stopped' state.

      • clockToPrint

        java.lang.String clockToPrint
        Textual representation of the time value -hour, minute and seconds-.

      • clockToPrintBlink

        boolean clockToPrintBlink
        Modifies the textual representation of the time value. It is used as a graphic effect trigger while clock is running: - When FALSE, colons are printed between the components 00:00:00 - When TRUE, colons are not printed between components 00 00 00

    • Constructor Detail

      • GenericClock

        public GenericClock()
        Default constructor. All variables are initialized to: - Zero. - Null. - False.

      • GenericClock

        public GenericClock(int hour,
                    int minute,
                    int second,
                    javax.swing.JLabel label)
        Creates Clock with initial time value and assigned GUI label. Time value is hour:minute:second (i.e: 12:20:34).
        Parameters:
        hour - hour value (min. value 0; max. value 23).
        minute - minute value (min. value 0; max. value 59).
        second - seconds value (min. value 0; max. value 59).
        label - GUI label to be attached to the clock.

      • GenericClock

        public GenericClock(javax.swing.JLabel label)
        Creates Clock that matchs the System Time. Initial time value is equal to System Time of the local machine. It has attached a label too.
        Parameters:
        label - label to be attached to the clock.

    • Method Detail

      • doInBackground

        protected java.lang.Integer doInBackground()
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Core functionality of GenericClock. It implements the loop operations executed by the Clock.
        Specified by:
        doInBackground in class javax.swing.SwingWorker<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>
        Returns:
        time value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - SwingWorker exception.
        See Also:
        SwingWorker, SwingWorker.doInBackground()

      • updateClock

        protected void updateClock()
        Updates clock, increasing the second counter by one. Basic operation of GenericClock. It updates the time value by one second, working as a normal clock. When time value reachs its max. value, it returns to the min. value (hour in digital format). - Max. value: 23:59:59 - Min. value: 00:00:00

      • printClock

        protected java.lang.String printClock()
        Prints time value in the attached label. Time value is parsed to a String, in order to print it in the attached label. Blinking effect is performed. Each component -hour, minute, second - is printed in a two digit format. I.e: 03:20:21
        Returns:
        time value in String format.

      • pauseClock

        public void pauseClock()
        Pauses clock. Set 'paused' to True.
        See Also:
        paused

      • startClock

        public void startClock()
        Starts clock. Sets 'paused' and stopped to False.
        See Also:
        paused, stopped

      • stopClock

        public void stopClock()
        Stops the clock. Sets 'stoppe'd to True. 'pauseClock()' method is executed too for safety. Time value is restarted to zero.
        See Also:
        stopped, pauseClock()
